>>33504413
Scheme is smaller and more elegant, CL is bigger and more practical.

Scheme would be the better choice if you're just wanting to make small personal utilities, or if you wanted an embeddable language, but I'd use CL for full-sized applications.

posts.com:
>>33504571
IDK if there's a way to set it up from like apache configuration, but you could have your pages loaded from some sort of script rather than directly loading the static pages. Then the script could read and check the headers for the useragent before sending anything.

Safari (at least the desktop one) has a built in way to change the useragent though, and it's generally dead simple to change/not send it with every browser.

Plus you kind of end up looking as dumb as that "how do I code my programs to not work in Wine" guy.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33504920
I'd say user agent is your only bet. Or make
access to your site dependent on Flash lol.

I'm certain every major web server supports CGI scripting so I didn't mean to imply only Apache will work.

uses dos, htmlutils, sysutils;
var
    user_agent  : string;
    page        : string;
    deny_access : boolean;
    ref         : text;
    ch          : char;
    query       : thttpquery;
    pair        : thttpquerypair;
begin
    writeln('Content-Type: text/html');
    writeln;

    query := getquery(getenv('QUERY_STRING'));

    page := '';

    for pair in query do case pair[0] of
        'page' : page := pair[1]
    end;

    user_agent := upcase(getenv('HTTP_USER_AGENT'));

    deny_access := (pos('IPHONE', user_agent) > 0) or
        (pos('IPOD', user_agent) > 0) or
        (pos('IPAD', user_agent) > 0);
    
    writeln('<p>Your User Agent string is: ', user_agent, '</p>');

    if deny_access then
    begin
        writeln('<h1>');
        writeln('Why are you using such a shitty device?');
        writeln('</h1>')
    end
    else if page = '' then
    begin
        writeln('<h1>');
        writeln('You seem ok, but you didn''t specify page!');
        writeln('</h1>')
    end
    else if fileexists(page) then
    begin
        assign(ref, page);
        reset(ref);
        repeat
            read(ref, ch);
            write(ch)
        until eof(ref);
        close(ref)
    end
    else begin
        writeln('<h1>');
        writeln('You seem ok, but that page doesn''t exist!');
        writeln('</h1>')
    end
end.


http://kibj.nprog.ru/debug/content.cgi?page=test.htm

This script looks for "iphone", "ipod", or "ipad" in the user agent, if it find it it blocks them, otherwise it outputs the contents of the page they want (if it exists). And the directory denies direct access to test.htm too, so they can also see it through the content.cgi script.

You could also get more specific with the agent strings:
http://www.enterpriseios.com/wiki/Complete_List_of_iOS_User_Agent_Strings

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33505308
The complaint here is that the return value of getStatus appears to be "stringly typed" - that is, the compiler can't check for you that your status string is a valid value for the status field. This is acceptable if additional statuses can be defined dynamically by the user. However, you ought to use an enum type instead if the list of possible statuses is known at compile time.

>>33505388
No IDE, just open the page with different browsers lol.

The "Develop" menubar is built into Safari, most
other browsers have a config where you can change the user agent manually or some extension/addon that gives you a similar menu.

https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/user-agent-switcher-for-c/djflhoibgkdhkhhcedjiklpkjnoahfmg?hl=en-US

https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/user-agent-switcher/
